DataElement.preferredName: Person Family Need Physical Condition FACT-G Questionnaire Scale Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric score from the scale used by FACT-G Quality of Life questionnaire to assess a person's trouble meeting family needs during to physical condition. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Problem Family Need Physical Condition
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A single human being._A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution._A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption._Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior._Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit._A state of being, such as a state of health.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.:Family; a domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.:Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.

Concepts.definition: A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
A domestic group, or a number of domestic groups linked through descent (demonstrated or stipulated) from a common ancestor, marriage, or adoption.

Anything that is necessary but lacking; the psychological feature that arouses an organism to action toward a desired goal; the reason for the action; that which gives purpose and direction to behavior.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the body.:A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated with permission from Dr. David Cella for use by CCR to collect FACT-G (v4.0) data in C3D.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from the 5-step scale used by FACT-G Quality of Life questionnaires to assess a patient. [Manually-curated]

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.:an ordered reference standard.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A general quality of life instrument intended for use with a variety of chronic illness conditions. A core instrument in the Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy (FACIT) Measurement System, a system which has multiple disease-, treatment-, and condition-specific subscales to complement the FACT-G.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Because of my physical condit
ReferenceDocuments.description: Because of my physical condition, I have trouble meeting the needs of my family.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated with permission from Dr. David Cella for use by CCR to capture FACT-G (v4.0) data in C3D.
